- Sessions log user-machine interaction, with chat messages and solutions.

- Get all sessions for a machine/user.
- Get all chat messages for a session.

subtasks.description: Map application roles to database roles and permissions, aligning with Supabase Auth integration.
subtasks.details:
Assign database privileges to roles (e.g., admin, user, guest) and ensure least-privilege access.
<info added on 2025-06-28T13:53:06.758Z>
Implement Role-Based Access Controls (RBAC) for the Supabase PostgreSQL schema as follows:

- Map application roles (admin, engineer, supervisor, operator) to database roles and permissions.
- Admins receive full access to all tables and actions (SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE).
- Engineers and supervisors are granted read/write access to machines, manuals, sessions, and messages within their department, but are restricted from performing certain admin actions such as deleting users.
- Operators have read-only access to most tables but can create sessions and messages for their own troubleshooting activities.
- Use Supabase Auth to assign roles at signup or via an admin panel, storing the role as a custom claim in the user's JWT.
- Enforce RBAC in Row Level Security (RLS) policies by checking the user's role from the JWT claims (e.g., using current_setting('request.jwt.claims', true)::json->>'role').
- Document the mapping of application roles to database permissions and ensure alignment with organizational requirements.

subtasks.title: Plan Supabase Storage Integration for Files/Documents
subtasks.description: Design how files and documents will be stored and referenced using Supabase Storage.

Define storage buckets, file metadata tables, and foreign key references from core entities to storage objects.
<info added on 2025-06-28T13:53:24.950Z>
Apply comprehensive data validation and integrity constraints to all storage-related tables and their relationships:

- Enforce NOT NULL constraints on all required fields in storage buckets, file metadata tables, and foreign key columns referencing core entities.
- Use UNIQUE constraints for fields that must be globally unique, such as storage object keys or file names within a bucket.
- Implement CHECK constraints to validate value ranges and formats (e.g., file size must be positive, file type must match allowed patterns).
- Define ENUM types for fields with a limited set of valid values, such as file status or storage class.
- Establish FOREIGN KEY constraints to maintain referential integrity between file metadata tables and core entities (e.g., linking files to users, machines, or troubleshooting sessions).
- Set DEFAULT values where appropriate, such as created_at = now() and id = gen_random_uuid().
- Ensure that data validation is also performed at the application layer using libraries like Zod to prevent invalid data from reaching the database.
This ensures robust data integrity and consistency for all storage-related entities in the Supabase PostgreSQL schema.
</info added on 2025-06-28T13:53:24.950Z>
